metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3858 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out of bounds read flaw was discovered in libssh2 before 1.8.1 when a specially crafted SFTP packet is received from the server. A remote attacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to cause a Denial of Service or read data in the client memory. It was discovered that libssh2 incorrectly handled specially crafted SFTP packets. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or obtain sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-3858` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssh2-1 - 1.8.0-2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libssh2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.0-2.1').
